1.name: Dynamic Warm-Up
1.note: Easy bike or jump rope + leg swings, hip circles, arm circles, T-spine rotations, walking lunges

1.name: Kettlebell Swing (Power Primer)
1.note: Explosive hip drive, neutral spine; rest ~60s

1.name: Jumping Bulgarian Split Squat (Bodyweight)
1.note: Explosive rear-foot-elevated jump; soft landing; knee tracks over toes; 60–90s rest

1.name: Barbell Bench Press
1.note: Scapula retracted; feet planted; controlled bar path; SUPerset with Pull-Ups

1.name: Pull-Ups (band-assisted if needed)
1.note: Overhand grip; full ROM; controlled eccentric

1.name: One-Arm DB Row (Bench-Supported)
1.note: Squeeze at top; avoid torso twist; neutral spine

1.name: Goblet Squat (KB/DB)
1.note: Front-loaded; upright torso; depth with control (reduced volume to balance week)

1.name: Cooldown Stretch
1.note: Quads, hamstrings, calves, chest, lats; slow breathing

2.name: Stationary Bike HIIT – Option A (4x4)
2.note: Hard at ~85–90% max effort; include 5–10 min warm-up + 5 min cool-down

2.name: Stationary Bike HIIT – Option B (Sprints)
2.note: RPE 9–10 on sprints; choose A or B (not both)

2.name: Post-HIIT Mobility
2.note: Hip flexors, hamstrings, calves, chest/shoulders, T-spine rotations

3.name: Dynamic Warm-Up
3.note: Bike or jump rope + mobility: leg swings, world’s greatest stretch, arm circles, hip openers

3.name: Kettlebell Clean Practice (Technique)
3.note: Single- or double-KB; crisp hip snap; rack softly without banging forearm

3.name: Single-Arm Kettlebell Press (Strict)
3.note: From rack; ribs down; glute squeeze; no lean

3.name: Goblet or Double-KB Front Squat
3.note: Elbows forward; brace; full-foot pressure; SUPerset with Arnold Press optional on light weeks

3.name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlift (DB or KB)
3.note: Hips square; slight knee bend; balance focus

3.name: Renegade Row (DB)
3.note: Plank position; resist hip rotation; slow control

3.name: Offset Farmer’s Carry
3.note: Carry one side only; tall posture; anti-lateral flexion

3.name: Optional: Incline Dumbbell Press
3.note: Upper-chest emphasis if shoulders feel fresh; skip if pressing volume is high

3.name: Cooldown Stretch
3.note: Hips, adductors, shoulders, T-spine; deep breathing

4.name: Dynamic Mobility Circuit
4.note: Leg swings, hip openers, shoulder dislocates (band/towel), T-spine rotations, ankle circles

4.name: Yoga / Static Stretch Flow
4.note: Down dog↔cobra, pigeon, low lunge w/ twist, triangle, child’s pose; 30–60s holds

5.name: Dynamic Warm-Up
5.note: Jump rope or easy bike + dynamic mobility

5.name: Armor Building Complex (Dan John–Inspired, Double KB)
5.note: Use two matching KBs. Do 1 clean, 1 press, 1 front squat = 1 rep. Perform 5 reps per round; rest 90s; complete 5–8 rounds. Keep reps crisp; stop 1–2 reps in reserve.

5.name: Chin-Ups (Underhand Grip)
5.note: Controlled tempo; full ROM; band-assisted if needed

5.name: Lateral Lunge (DB or KB optional)
5.note: Controlled side-to-side; hip/adductor strength; balances sagittal plane work

5.name: Farmer’s Carry (Heavy, DB or KB)
5.note: Heavy implements; tall posture; strong grip

5.name: Pallof Press (Band or Cable)
5.note: Press straight out; resist rotation; core stability

5.name: Cooldown Stretch
5.note: Stretch chest/shoulders (pressing), hips/quads (front squats); relaxed breathing

6.name: Cardio – Steady State
6.note: Bike, jog, row, swim; conversational pace

6.name: Optional: Jump Rope + BW Circuit
6.note: Short finisher only if fresh; minimal rest between moves

7.name: Rest Day
7.note: Optional easy walk and gentle stretching
